title: From A, Yaa walks 8km north to B, then 6km east to C. How far is C from A? - Quora

response.answer_text: I answered this on Tuesday! Here it is again. If you ask how far is C from A, Pythagoras gives 10 km. (3. 4 , 5 triangle). So that is a good answer over most of the planet’s surface but there are some exceptions. Within 8 km of the North Pole you cannot walk 8 km north. You run out of northness! Start a tiny amount further south and when you walk 6 km east you are going round in a tiny circle, ending up 8 km from your starting point. If you start at the South Pole, walk 8 km north then walk any distance east or west and you stay 8 km from the start. So I guest the answer is between 8 and 10 km depending on from where you start.

You should have use the Pythagorean Theorem to answer this. Which is The square root of a2 + b2 =C2. if a2 is 8x8 which =64 and b2 = 6x6 = 36 a2 (64) + b2 (36) = 100 Square root of 100 = 10 so your answer is the square root of 64 + 36 = square root of 100 answer: 10
